Question 22 
[Transportation Engineering : Geometrical Design of Highway]
 
 
 
A car is travelling at a speed of 60 km/hr on a section of a National Highway having a downward gradient 
of 2%. The driver of the car suddenly observes a stopped vehicle on the car path at a distance 130 m ahead, 
and applies brake. If the brake efficiency is 60%, coefficient of friction is 0.7, driver’s reaction time is 2.5
s, and acceleration due to gravity is 
2
9.81 m/s ,
 the distance (in meters) required by the driver to bring the
car to a safe stop lies in the range
(A) 126 to 130 
(B) 41 to 45
(C) 33 to 37 
(D) 75 to 79 
Ans. (D)
